Issues.Title: Update checks for screen.WorkingArea
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

Update checks for `Screen.WorkingArea` to allow for multiple monitors of different resolutions.

For instance, with two monitors where the right monitor is vertical, `Bounds: {X = 2560 Y = 0 Width = 1440 Height = 2560}`.

## Customer Impact

Test change only.

## Risk

Low.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1873)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update checks for screen.WorkingArea" (#1873)

Issues.Title: make changing targetframework easier in the future, do not actually override TargetFrameworkVersion and Name which are used elsewhere
Issues.Body:
Spoke with Eric about the dangers of overwriting TargetFrameworkVersion and Name with our own values. This is my own fault as I did not realize the risks; other places expect to use these values, so we need to use our own private ones. 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1872)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "make changing targetframework easier in the future, do not actually override TargetFrameworkVersion and Name which are used elsewhere" (#1872)

Issues.Title: Port additional VB runtime methods to dotnet/winforms
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

Continued port of Microsoft.VisualBasic from https://github.com/Microsoft/referencesource/tree/master/Microsoft.VisualBasic/runtime/msvbalib.

Changes to the code ported from referencesource:
- Cleaned up comments, and removed commented out code
- Removed attribute use {HostProtection,SecuritySafeCritical,SecurityPermission,ResourceConsumption,ResourceExposure}
- Removed permission demands

_Note: This PR is currently based on https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1675. The initial commits are from that earlier PR._

## Test methodology

Unit tests for a number of methods, primarily testing simple code paths since this is a port of existing code. Integration tests for methods that rely on System.Windows.Forms.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1871)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Port additional VB runtime methods to dotnet/winforms" (#1871)

Issues.Title: Fix issue 1864 - Different accessible names for property grids
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1864


## Proposed changes

- Added providing indexable accessible name for PropertyGrid control (by default). New default accessible name equals to default control name, for instance "propertyGrid1", "propertyGrid2" and so on.
- Added providing indexable accessible name for PropertyGrid's inner table.


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- With the fix available, multiple tables in Form have different names. Screen reader will also announce PropertyGrid's names and table names correctly..


## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Low

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

<!-- TODO -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23213980/64702682-a42a9780-d4b3-11e9-83d0-24f3a101e1cd.png)


### After

<!-- TODO -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23213980/64703167-96294680-d4b4-11e9-963a-250131fffae3.png)



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual testing. Tools: Inspect, Accessibility insights.
- Automation, need QA approval.
- Unit tests (to be implemented)

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
<!-- use `dotnet --info` -->
  2.1.700-preview-009601 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.801 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  3.0.100-preview8-012929 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:

Issues.Title: Accessibility: PropertyGrid child tables have identical names
Issues.Body:
**Repro steps:**
1. Create .NET Core WinForms app with two PropertyGrid controls and launch it.
3. Start Accessibility insights / Inspect app.
4. Check the names of both tables present on screen.
 
**Actual:**
Issue 1: Both tables have same name "Properties Window".
 
**Expected:**
Issue 1: Both tables should have different names so as to differentiate between them.
 
**User Impact:**
As both tables have same name, screen reader will also announce same which would confuse screen reader users.

DevDiv issue: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/956750
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: PropertyGrid child tables have identical names" (#1864)

Issues.Title: Question: Are there plans to separate Visual Styles from the OS?
Issues.Body: As WinForms becomes more and more open, is there scope or plans to lift the Visual Style system (UXTheme) out of the OS, so the visual look of controls can be updated without an OS update, and be kept in sync with future UI changes in other Windows frameworks like WPF and WinUI?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Question: Are there plans to separate Visual Styles from the OS?" (#1855)

Issues.Title: WIP: Fixing availability of ShowCellToolTips and ShowCellErrors setters
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

## Proposed changes

- Change implementation of the `set` blocks of `ShowCellToolTips` and `ShowCellErrors` properties in `DataGridView.cs` to avoid possible problems

> ❗️ We must not use getters in setters.
We already had a serious bug (#1661) due to such use.


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- No


## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- No

 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18362.295]
- .Net Core version: 3.0.0-rc1-19455-02


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
